dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9260 IH: Stop Online Suicide Assistance Forums Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Trahan (for herself, Mr. Carey, Mr. Stewart, and Ms. Porter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of mail or interstate communications to assist suicide, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Online Suicide Assistance Forums Act.

subsection.text: Chapter 51 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Prohibiting assisted suicide through certain communications

subsection.text: Whoever uses mail or interstate communication to intentionally assist another individual in taking that individual’s own life, and death results, shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 5 years, or both.
Any action taken in accordance with State laws governing physician-assisted end of life shall not constitute an offense under subsection (a).

paragraph.text: Nothing in this section shall preempt the authority of a State to enact laws relating to assisted suicide within such State.
Nothing in this section shall be interpreted to make unlawful or otherwise criminalize the act of suicide or deliberate self-injury, or punish the person committing any such act.
The term assist means, with respect to a person assisting another individual in taking that individual’s own life, that—

subparagraph.text: the person specifically aims to facilitate the individual’s suicide; and

the person furnishes the individual with substantial material support to facilitate the suicide, or with substantial communication facilitating the suicide at the same time as an attempt or act of suicide is occurring.

paragraph.text: The term material support means any tangible property.

subsection.text: The table of section for chapter 51 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1123. Prohibiting assisted suicide through certain communications.
